body: There should be a `config.log` file in `src/php/ext/grpc` that has more details about why `./configure` failed. Can you check what it says?

Ah, looks like the library `rt` is missing

```
configure:4103: checking for grpc files in default path
configure:4108: result: found in /usr/local
configure:4366: checking for gpr_now in -lgpr
configure:4392: cc -o conftest -g -O2  -Wl,-rpath,/usr/local/lib -L/usr/local/lib  -Wl,-rpath,/usr/local/lib -L/usr/local/lib conftest.c -lgpr  -lrt -ldl -lpthread  >&5
ld: library not found for -lrt
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
configure:4392: $? = 1
configure: failed program was:
| /* confdefs.h */
| #define PACKAGE_NAME ""
| #define PACKAGE_TARNAME ""
| #define PACKAGE_VERSION ""
| #define PACKAGE_STRING ""
| #define PACKAGE_BUGREPORT ""
| #define PACKAGE_URL ""
| /* end confdefs.h.  */
| 
| /* Override any GCC internal prototype to avoid an error.
|    Use char because int might match the return type of a GCC
|    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
| #ifdef __cplusplus
| extern "C"
| #endif
| char gpr_now ();
| int
| main ()
| {
| return gpr_now ();
|   ;
|   return 0;
| }
configure:4401: result: no
configure:4452: error: wrong gpr lib version or lib not found
```

Looks like we should not link to `rt` if on Mac?

[link1](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1505402/library-not-found-for-lrt-with-qtcreator-mac-os), [link2](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12692876/how-to-build-linux-osx-makefile-needing-clock-gettime-function)

It looks like we should not. The [Node gyp file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/src/node/binding.gyp#L27) does not link against `rt` if the OS is Mac, and the [Python setup.py file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/src/python/src/setup.py#L56) has a similar check.

why?


Please install the extension via the `[sudo] pecl install grpc-beta` command. See the [README](../tree/master/src/php) for more information.
